item.title: How Energy Efficiency Can Help Manage the Duck Curve
item.description:
How Energy Efficiency Can Help Manage the Duck Curve

Distributed generation is changing the load shape of the grid. Increasingly, the traditional afternoon peak is being replaced by an afternoon valley, when solar generation is at its highest. The valley period is in turn followed by a steep and problematic peak in the late afternoon, as power from solar generation decreases, people return home from work and school, and residential loads increase.

item.title: Masdar to grant financial aid for Pacific solar energy projects
item.description:
Masdar to grant financial aid for Pacific solar energy projects

UAE has entered into a partnership deal to provide $50 million fund for renewable energy projects in four Pacific island countries. The countries to be financed under UAE-Pacific Partnership Fund are Marshall Islands, Nauru, Palau, and the Solomon Islands. The grant financing was announced by Abu Dhabi Fund for Development (ADFD) during the Abu Dhabi Sustainability Week.
